name: Legendary Performers Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Bob Hope is best known in the movies for his 'Road' films with Bing Crosby. Which place was NOT one of their movie destinations ?
questions.explanation:
Mexico.

	One of the most successful ongoing series in movie history

questions.text: Elizabeth Taylor won an Oscar for 'Butterfield 8'. Who wrote the book on which the movie was based?
questions.explanation:
John O'Hara.

	I don't know about the book - but the movie was a dud

questions.text: One of Alfred Hitchcock's thrillers was 'Strangers on a Train'. Who played the deranged killer?
questions.explanation:
Robert Walker.

	He did a good job. Granger was the co-star.

questions.text: John Wayne had an early success with 'The Searchers' . Who played the girl that he was searching for?
Frank Sinatra had a good role in 'The Manchurian Candidate'. Who played the brainwashing victim?
Bette Davis co-starred with her rival, Joan Crawford, in which one of these movies?
questions.explanation:
Whatever Happened to Baby Jane?.

	It's strange to see a legend in stuff like this.

questions.text: Marilyn Monroe's marriage to Joe DiMaggio suffered a setback as a result of a scene in which her dress is blown high up in the air. What movie is that scene from?
questions.explanation:
The Seven Year Itch.

	Slight Comedy.

questions.text: Barbra Streisand made a good movie, 'Funny Girl', and a few that weren't so memorable. Which one of these is NOT one of hers?
questions.explanation:
Up the Down Staircase.

	Don't run out to rent any of them.

questions.text: Judy Garland was not the first choice for the 'Wizard of Oz'. Who was?
questions.explanation:
Shirley Temple.

	Superstar Shirley was the first choice - but was unavailable.

questions.text: Clark Gable and Spencer Tracy were giants; they occasionally worked together. Which film featured both of them?
questions.explanation:
Boom Town.

	Good movie - better than 'San Francisco'.
